newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate inches up to 10.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate inches up to 10.3 pct.

text.p: Croatia's average lending rate inched up ten basis points to 10.3 percent on Tuesday, pulled up by higher rates for term funds.
Dealers said total settlements shrank to 21.3 million kuna, leaving a surplus of 31.7 million on the supply side.
New loans totalled 11.5 million kuna, mostly granted at the steady call money rate of 9.0 percent.
Interbank money ranged between 11.0 percent for two-week fresh funds and 17.0 percent for old loans. Insurers rolled over previous loans at 9.0 percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Wednesday slightly firmer at 5.5436 against the dollar and at 3.5657 versus the German mark. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
